title: Simple past tense -DI and -DU explained
desc: Learn about the suffix of past tense in Turkish

body.raw:
## Simple past tense -DI and -DU ( belirtili ge√ßmi≈ü zaman ) --- Simple past tense in Turkish is actually very simple :). The suffix that used in the past tense of nouns, verbs or an adjectives is generally -**DI** or -**DU**. - **D** ‚Üí `d` or `t` ( Rule of **f-s-t-k-√ß-≈ü-h-p** ) - **I** ‚Üí `ƒ±` or `i` ( Vowel harmony i.e ease of pronunciation ) - **U** ‚Üí `u` or `√º` ( Vowel harmony i.e ease of pronunciation ) Don‚Äôt be overwhelmed by this formula. The image below summarizes it all. üìå The ‚Äò**d**‚Äô becomes ‚Üí ‚Äò**t**‚Äô when the last letter is one of the **f-s-t-k-√ß-≈ü-h-p**. ### Examples

1. Verbs

| Turkish Verb | English Verb | Past Tense (3rd Person Singular) | English | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | Gitmek | To go | Git**ti** | went | | Gelmek | To come | Gel**di** | came | | Yemek | To eat | Ye**di** | ate | | ƒ∞√ßmek | To drink | ƒ∞√ß**ti** | drank | | Uyumak | To sleep | Uyu**du** | slept | | Okumak | To read | Oku**du** | read | - üü© - root of verb - üü® - indicator of verb (All verbs in Turkish end with `mak` or `mek`) - üü• - past tense suffix ---

2. Adjectives

| Turkish Adjective | English Adjective | Past Tense (3rd Person Singular) | English | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | B√ºy√ºk | Big | B√ºy√ºk**t√º** | It was big | | K√º√ß√ºk | Small | K√º√ß√ºk**t√º** | It was small | | Yeni | New | Yeniy**di** | It was new | | Eski | Old | Eskiy**di** | It was old | | G√ºzel | Beautiful | G√ºzel**di** | It was beautiful | | ƒ∞yi | Good | ƒ∞yiy**di** | It was good | ---

3. Nouns

| Turkish Noun | English Noun | Past Tense (3rd Person Singular) | English Translation | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | Masa | Table | ‚Ä¶g√ºzel masay**dƒ±**. | It was beautiful table | | Resim | Picture | ‚Ä¶b√ºy√ºk resim**di**. | It was big picture | | Arkada≈ü | Friend | ‚Ä¶samimi arkada≈ü**tƒ±**. | He/she was sincere friend | | ≈ûehir | City | ‚Ä¶b√ºy√ºk ≈üehir**di**. | It was big city | | Yemek | Food | ‚Ä¶lezzetli yemek**ti**. | It was delicious food | | M√ºzik | Music | ...harika m√ºzik**ti**. | It was great music | --- ‚ôüÔ∏è If the last letter of the word a **noun** or an **adjective** is a **vowel,** ‚Äòy‚Äô comes in between as a separator. ‚ôüÔ∏è There is also a non suffix way of expressing past tense by using the word **idi** after a noun and adjective. - ‚ôüÔ∏è Example would be g√ºzel**di** ‚Üí g√ºzel **idi**, durust**tu** ‚Üí **idi**. - In this case **no need** to consider `vowel harmony` or `f-s-t-k-√ß-≈ü-h-p` rules, just add **idi** to any noun or adjective. --- Thanks for reading!
